definitions.definition: To go after; to pursue; to move behind in the same path or direction.
To go or come after in a sequence.
definitions.example: B follows A in the alphabet.
Follow these instructions to the letter.

definitions.definition: To live one's life according to (religion, teachings, etc).
To understand, to pay attention to.
To watch, to keep track of (reports of) some event or person.
definitions.example: I followed the incumbent throughout the election.

definitions.definition: To subscribe to see content from an account on a social media platform.
definitions.example: If you want to see more of our articles, follow us on Twitter.

definitions.definition: To be a logical consequence of something.
definitions.example: If you don't practise proper hygiene, illness is sure to follow.

definitions.definition: To walk in, as a road or course; to attend upon closely, as a profession or calling.
A group of followers, attendants or admirers; an entourage.
(with definite article, treated as singular or plural) A thing or things to be mentioned immediately after.
definitions.example: The following are the three most important questions.

definitions.definition: Coming next, either in sequence or in time.

definitions.example: The following words have no definition [...]

definitions.definition: (of a wind) Blowing in the direction of travel.
definitions.example: The following wind sped us on our way.
Following the meeting, we all had a chat.
